entry.title: Vendor Master Customization(Implementation).
entry.content:
Hi All,

I got a requirement from Business user, They want when End user fill data manually in BP to make Vendor Code, Normal when we save they provide me Vendor Code. But their requirement is User when save SAP not provide them Vendor Code , Only allow to save the DATA. After the finance approval only after approval or When Finance approve it by Approval Button only then they get the Vendor Code automatically on the End user Mail id.

My idea  is, We can make Custom T-CODE with the help of ABAP just like BP, And custom tables to store data.

I want to know the feasibility, Idea and solution for the requirement.

Please help me here.

entry.title: Complex Value Help for Multidimensional Query (CDS-Query)
entry.content:
Hi,

im trying to implement a value help for the business partner field with more than the description field (e.g. streetname, country etc.).

Similiar to the value help for CompanyCode (inherit from a standard cds view)

I tried to create a similiar value help for business partner

but it is not working (only description field, no country)

 

This is the CDS-Cube used for the query

I think building a complex value help for a fiori elements report could be realized with Consumption.valueHelpDefnition, but it is not working for cds-queries build with custom analytical queries fiori app.

best regards

entry.title: enable barcode for Serial ID on RF screen
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We have a requirement to enable Barcode for Serial ID field in Bin-to-Bin scenario. Upon scanning the barcode string, Serial ID need be decoded so that it gets added as new line item to the scanned List.

This way business will get to know how many serial Ids are scanned.

 FM - /SCWM/RF_XSERNR_PAI gets triggered when you enter Serial Id manually or when 2D barcode string is entered in Input field.

It is working when we enter Serial ID manually hit enter.  Serial ID gets add to the scanned list as below.

In the standard RF screen, Serial ID field is just declared of type Input/Output. We have created custom screen and enabled property Barcode = 'TRUE' and checked it as scrollable. default length made it as 255, output as 18.

As we declared output length as 18 and we are passing input as 2D barcode string, ABAP dump is raised with message ‘Output field too short for converted value’ because of the SERIAL ID conversion exit routine.

Dump says System is expecting plain Serial ID as an input. We validated BADI - /SCWM/EX_BARC_DECODE but it is not triggering in our case.

FYI - Conversion routine is triggered before PAI FM is triggered.

Expectation – We are looking for BADI or Enhancement before Routine where we can write custom logic to decode the barcode string and pass Serial Id as input (like we are currently entering manually).

I just wanted to check if anyone has worked on similar kind of requirement.

RF menu Path - 050205, Logical transaction -AHPRTO, step - XSERNR

 

Thank you.

Regards,

Karthik

entry.title: My inbox PO enhancement with PO Changes as a composition
entry.content:
Hello, i'm trying to add a table of PO Changes made using CDS View into the Purchase Order Approval detail page in My Inbox.

I tried the mentioned blog below, but no success yet.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/my-inbox-po-enhancement-with-approvers-as-a-composition/qaa-p/12673395#M4754835

I made the following CDS View to show the purchase changes and added it to C_PurchaseOrderFs Extension.

After that, i made a enhancement into MPC_EXT as mentioned in the blog trying to add the association into the Metadata of the SEGW service C_PURCHASEORDER_FS.

 

But, the change is not reflecting yet in the My Inbox App, i only see a new area with the title but no table is displayed there.
i have already tried to extend the SEGW service, but it does not work with My inbox. I also tried a new service, but that didn't work also. As i understood from the blog, the guys were able to solve it using the standard service and adding some enhancement only, but the main problem here is that i'm not able to see the associations and also, i'm unable to add the associations. 
Do you guys have any idea on how i could solve it?

thanks.

entry.title: ALV display : 'ZERO' object reference is not possible during more entries
entry.content:
Hi,

I am displaying ALV output report using cl_salv_table=>factory.
While displaying columns headers, i am renaming them with more meaningful desc using:

  CALL METHOD lo_colstab->get_column as below:

  
TRY.
CALL METHOD lo_colstab->get_column
EXPORTING
columnname = 'ERRTYP'
RECEIVING
value = lv_colname. " TYPE REF TO CL_SALV_COLUMN
CATCH cx_salv_not_found .
ENDTRY.

lv_colname->set_short_text( 'Errtyp' ).


Now, when my ALV output is showing 10,000 entries it works fine where
lv_colname is holding {O:90*\CLASS=CL_SALV_COLUMN_TABLE}.

But when the ALV is trying to show more entries like >25000 it dumps saying like:
"Access using a 'ZERO' object reference is not possible." & is pointing to this line
 lv_colname->set_short_text( 'Errtyp' ).

At this time, lv_colname is NULL.

Why is this behavior seen when there are more entries to be displayed in ALV output?

 

Thanks

entry.title: MDG Highlight Changes
entry.content:
Hello Gals and Guys

In MDGIMG you can check or uncheck if to Highlight Changes (HC) or not:

So it means that for Application BS_OVP_BP / Configuration BS_OVP_CU changes should be highlighted.

this is what we have here:

I assume that there are all entities / uibbs and feeder clases under this application / config ... 

So there must be kind of "loop" where these ( configs/apps/uibbs ) are processed (and highlighted).

Where it happens? In handler class? If so ... which method?

I am asking because there is one section (relationships ) that is not highlighted and I am trying to find why.

Thank you.

entry.title: Dynamic Template Download Upload Report on Year
entry.content:
Recantly , I was working on an requirement and sharing the same.

We need to develop a program to upload the Monthly Production plan. In input screen user will enter the year and execute we should get an excel template downloaded with columns Matnr , Plant and followed month of year. Upload function we will fill those details and upload will be saved to custom table and we need to give runtime save in alv(editable).

we will get year as input then we generate this template, and we will upload the same but there is twist we will upload data column-wise, but we need to update it row-wise here,

A010, B2, 1000, 2025, 01(Jan) this will one record in same way we will update all 12 records with respect to first row as A010, B2, 30, 2025, 12(Dec) in custom table.

Example:

PlantModel name25-Jan25-Feb25-Mar25-Apr25-May25-Jun25-Jul25-Aug25-Sep25-Oct25-Nov25-Dec
A010B21000400300500500300200500500604030
A010B32004003005005003002005005006040200
A010B45004003005005003002005005006040400
A010B53004003005005003002005005006040600

Difficult things to do in this task:

  • Generating the excel template on year (but we can do it easily). 
  • Handling uploaded data where in this requirement we need to update data row-wise in the system.
  • Selection Screen Design (Easy).

Simple Implementation: 

REPORT zztest_download_upload.

TABLES: sscrfields.
TYPE-POOLS: truxs.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_data,
         col1  TYPE string,
         col2  TYPE string,
         col3  TYPE string,
         col4  TYPE string,
         col5  TYPE string,
         col6  TYPE string,
         col7  TYPE string,
         col8  TYPE string,
         col9  TYPE string,
         col10 TYPE string,
         col11 TYPE string,
         col12 TYPE string,
         col13 TYPE string,
         col14 TYPE string,
       END OF tp_data.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_heading,
         heading(30),
       END OF tp_heading.

DATA: gt_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gf_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gv_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gd_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gs_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gt_heading  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_heading,
      gs_heading  TYPE tp_heading,
      gt_fieldcat TYPE TABLE OF slis_fieldcat_alv,
      gs_fieldcat TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
      lv_date     TYPE string,
      lv_month    TYPE string,
      lv_year     TYPE string,
      lv_new_date TYPE string,
      lv_index    TYPE sy-tabix,
      lv_cell     TYPE string,
      index       TYPE I.
DATA : gs_prod_plan TYPE zzmm_m_prod_plan.

FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_cell>    TYPE string,
               <fs_input>   TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_input_1> TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_month>   TYPE tp_data,
               <fs_value>   TYPE any,
               <fs_value_1> TYPE any.
DATA : lv_field               TYPE char5,
       gv_model               TYPE mname,
       gv_plant               TYPE mcode,
       gv_filename            TYPE string,
       gv_path                TYPE string,
       gv_fullpath            TYPE string,
       gv_result              TYPE i,
       gv_template_downloaded TYPE abap_bool VALUE abap_false,
       it_raw                 TYPE truxs_t_text_data,
       gv_year                TYPE char4.

*INITIALIZATION.
*  gv_year = sy-datum+0(4).

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-001.
  PARAMETERS: rb_down RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp DEFAULT 'X' USER-COMMAND rb-s1,
              rb_up   RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b2 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  PARAMETERS: s_file TYPE rlgrap-filename MODIF ID sc2.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b2.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  SELECT-OPTIONS: p_model  FOR gv_model MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_plant  TYPE mcode MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_year  TYPE t009b-bdatj OBLIGATORY.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b3.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ELSE.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.


AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR s_file.
  CALL FUNCTION 'F4_FILENAME'
    EXPORTING
      field_name   = 'S_FILE'
      program_name = sy-cprog
    IMPORTING
      file_name    = s_file.


START-OF-SELECTION.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
    PERFORM build_headings.
    PERFORM get_save_location.
    PERFORM download.
  ELSEIF rb_up = 'X'.
    PERFORM build_headings.
    PERFORM upload_file.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  GET_SAVE_LOCATION
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM get_save_location.
  CONCATENATE 'Template_' sy-datum sy-uzeit INTO gv_filename.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_save_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title      = 'Select the location'
      default_extension = 'xls'
      default_file_name = gv_filename
    CHANGING
      filename          = gv_filename
      path              = gv_path
      fullpath          = gv_fullpath
      user_action       = gv_result.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  BUILD_HEADINGS
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM build_headings.
  gs_heading-heading = 'Plant'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  gs_heading-heading = 'Model name'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  DATA: lt_month_names LIKE TABLE OF t247.
  CALL FUNCTION 'MONTH_NAMES_GET'
    TABLES
      month_names = lt_month_names
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS      = 1.

  LOOP AT lt_month_names INTO DATA(ls_month_name).
    CONCATENATE ls_month_name-ltx '' P_year INTO DATA(lv_header).
    gs_heading-heading = lv_header.
    APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
    CLEAR gs_heading.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  DOWNLOAD
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM download.
  LOOP AT p_model INTO DATA(s_model).
    gs_data-col1 = p_plant.
    gs_data-col2 = s_model-low.
    APPEND gs_data TO gt_data.
    CLEAR : gs_data.
  ENDLOOP.
  IF gv_fullpath IS NOT INITIAL.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
      EXPORTING
        filename   = gv_fullpath
        filetype   = 'DAT'
      TABLES
        data_tab   = gt_data
        fieldnames = gt_heading
      EXCEPTIONS
        OTHERS     = 22.

    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      gv_template_downloaded = abap_true.

      CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>execute
        EXPORTING
          document = gv_fullpath
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS   = 10.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  UPLOAD_FILE
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM upload_file.

  CALL FUNCTION 'TEXT_CONVERT_XLS_TO_SAP'
    EXPORTING
      i_tab_raw_data       = it_raw
      i_filename           = s_file
    TABLES
      i_tab_converted_data = gt_data
    EXCEPTIONS
      conversion_failed    = 1
      OTHERS               = 2.

  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    LOOP AT gt_heading INTO DATA(lv_fieldname).
      CLEAR: lv_field,gs_fieldcat.
      lv_field = |COL{ sy-tabix }|.
      gs_fieldcat-fieldname = lv_field."lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-seltext_l = lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-col_pos = sy-tabix.
      gs_fieldcat-ctabname = 'gt_data'.
      gs_fieldcat-edit = 'X'.
      APPEND gs_fieldcat TO gt_fieldcat.
    ENDLOOP.

    gv_data = gt_data.
    DELETE gv_data  INDEX 1.
    gf_data = gv_data.


    LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
      READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
      index = 1.
      DO 12 TIMES.
        ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
          gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
          gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
          gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
          gs_prod_plan-zmonth = index.
          gs_prod_plan-zyear = p_year.
          MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
        ENDIF.
        index = index + 1.
      ENDDO.
    ENDLOOP.

    CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
      EXPORTING
        i_callback_program       = sy-repid
        i_callback_pf_status_set = ' '
        i_callback_user_command  = 'SAVE'
        i_default                = 'X'
        i_save                   = 'S'
        it_fieldcat              = gt_fieldcat
      TABLES
        t_outtab                 = gv_data
      EXCEPTIONS
        program_error            = 1
        OTHERS                   = 2.


    MESSAGE 'File uploaded and data captured successfully.' TYPE 'S'.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE 'Error uploading file.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

FORM save USING rcomm TYPE sy-ucomm
      sel TYPE slis_selfield.

  CASE sy-ucomm.
    WHEN '&DATA_SAVE'.
      LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
        READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
        READ TABLE gf_data INTO gd_data INDEX sy-tabix.
        IF <fs_input> NE gd_data.
          DO 12 TIMES.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_month> TO <fs_value_1>.
            DATA: lv_date_string TYPE string,
                  lv_month_num   TYPE char2,
                  lv_day         TYPE char2,
                  lv_month_name  TYPE string.

            lv_date_string = <fs_value_1>.

            SPLIT lv_date_string AT '/' INTO lv_month_num lv_day lv_year.

            IF sy-subrc = 0.
              CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
              gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
              gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
              gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
              gs_prod_plan-zmonth = lv_month_num.
              gs_prod_plan-zyear = lv_year.
              MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
            ENDIF.
          ENDDO.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
  ENDCASE.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Update SODI e-mail
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

We use SODIs (SAPOffice Direct Communication Partners) to send emails to customers, through a program developed.

I was able to find these SODIs in the ADR6, ADRC and TSAD7 table. They are part of Function Group SZA0.

Now we need  to change the domain of these emails. Example: someone1@sender1.com to someone2@sender2.com

How can I carry out this maintenance?

Best regards,

entry.title: OUTB Delivery - Picking Request Doc do not confirm
entry.content:
Hi...

for some reason I can't figure out, I can't complete the Picking Request Document.

We have a system that creates a Sales Order and a Outb. Delivery. We have 2 scenarios...

1 - an Employee must pick the item itself and do the picking manually using the Pick Outbound Delivery app. This works fine..

2 - A customer pick an item directly from the shelf, so when the Sales Order + Outb. Dlvr are created, Picking and PGI should be automatically created.

Here's my issue on the second scenario... I'm not being able to complete the Picking Request Document, so the Picking Status is B, instead of C. [IMG 1]

And the Picking Request stays as "Open" [IMG 2]

I tried to use FM WS_DELIVERY_UPDATE, but I only get the error that the Piking Request is not completed. VL E 618.

If I try to pass the number of items in VBPOK_TAB, I get the error that the confirmed qty and the picked qty are different for the amount of the items..

I still can change the status to C if I manually do it on VL02N, but it does not call a BAPI or any other FM. [IMG 3]

any thoughts on how to make it work?

However, the code is not working.
Can anyone help me sort out this issue? It would be a great help. Thank you very much!

entry.title: Need Help with MB_MIGO_BADI Enhancement – Skip Shelf Life Check for PO Type ZNB7
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I need your advice on a MB_MIGO_BADI enhancement.

Requirement:
When the purchase order header field EKKO-BSART = 'ZNB7' and the movement type is 101, I want to skip the product (shelf life) date entry check during MIGO goods receipt.

I’ve implemented the BADI and tried to control this via the check_item and line_modify methods, but it’s not working — the system still prompts for the shelf life date.

Here’s my current code:

METHOD if_ex_mb_migo_badi~line_modify.
  IF gt_goitem[] IS NOT INITIAL.
    READ TABLE gt_goitem INTO DATA(gs_goitem) WITH KEY zeile = cs_goitem-zeile.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      APPEND cs_goitem TO gt_goitem.
    ELSE.
      MODIFY gt_goitem FROM cs_goitem INDEX sy-tabix.
    ENDIF.
  ELSE.
    APPEND cs_goitem TO gt_goitem.
  ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD if_ex_mb_migo_badi~check_item.
  IF sy-tcode = 'MIGO'.
    DATA: lv_bsart TYPE ekko-bsart.
    LOOP AT gt_goitem ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<cs_goitem>) 
           WHERE matnr IS NOT INITIAL AND zeile = i_line_id.
      IF <cs_goitem>-ebeln IS NOT INITIAL.
        SELECT SINGLE bsart
          INTO lv_bsart
          FROM ekko
         WHERE ebeln = <cs_goitem>-ebeln.
        IF sy-subrc = 0 AND lv_bsart = 'ZNB7'.
          <cs_goitem>-kzmhd = ''.  " Trying to disable check
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

I’m using a global internal table gt_goitem (type GOITEM) to store line item data.

Problem: The shelf life check is still enforced. The kzmhd flag doesn’t seem to take effect.

Question:
Is check_item the right method to suppress the shelf life check? Or should I be using malmi to modify im_t156-kzmhd?

Any guidance or corrected code example would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!
Best regards,

entry.title: Reference three fields from the same table in the same set.
entry.content:
In a set, we can normally reference a field from a table. I wanted to reference three fields from the same table in the same set. Is this possible?

In the image above where there is "from value" and "to value" I would need a field to identify different fields in the same table

Thank you in advance.
